Our Staff
Rev. Dr. David C. Mauldin, senior pastor
Email:
david@palmcitypres.org
Pastor David began his ministry with our church in August 2017. David earned his B.A. at Milligan College (TN), M.Div. at Louisville Presbyterian Theological Seminary (KY), and D.Min. at Beeson Divinity School (Samford University in Birmingham, AL). Prior to coming to PCPC, he served as pastor of Westminster Presbyterian Church in Mobile, AL, for 14 years. He has also served churches in Georgia, Tennessee, and Indiana.
Favorite book (other than
The Bible
):
The Brothers Karamazov
Favorite movie:
A River Runs Through It
If I were a superhero, I would be: Spiderman
Pastor Al Rivett, Interim Executive pastor
Email:
al@palmcitypres.org
Pastor Al is a commissioned
lay pastor with specialized interim pastor training. He served as transitional
pastor of Christ Presbyterian Church in Barnwell, South Carolina, for two
years. Al has been active in church leadership since 1996. His home congregation
is Indian River Presbyterian, where he has served as an elder. He has been
through the visioning process twice, once as an elder and once as a pastor. He
and his wife, Donna, make their home in Fort Pierce.
Al's professional career was mainly in community development and the non-profit world. He was the director of Habitat for Humanity in St. Lucie County. He worked for the St. Lucie County Chamber of Commerce as both Executive Vice President and Director of
Governmental Relations.
He
has served on the boards and chaired numerous community organizations.
Favorite book (other than
The Bible
):
I am a fan of author C.J. Box and his
Joe Pickett
series.
Favorite movie:
I've seen the last two seasons of
The Chosen
in the theater. My favorite non-Christian movie is
Independence Day
.
If I were a superhero, I would be: Barry Allen, The Flash
Jessica Waltersdorff, director of next generation ministry
Email:
jessica@palmcitypres.org
Born and raised in Stuart, Jessica is a true Florida native. She
holds a bachelor's degree in vocal performance from the University of North
Florida, an educational specialist degree in mathematics from Nova Southeastern
University, and a master's in organizational leadership from Gonzaga
University. Jessica has a diverse work background from florist to 911 emergency operations to educator in both public and private schools. She has taught all
ages from K-12 in music and mathematics. Jessica is married to Adam, and they
have three children: Logan (25), Lily (21), and Cara (17). Jessica enjoys the
natural beauty of God's creation. She spends her free time
boating/snorkeling, gardening, and quilting.
Favorite book:
Pride and Prejudice
Favorite movie: I have many "go to" movies for multiple
occasions
If I were a superhero, I would be: Thor, because I am confident
and willing to take on any challenge.
Trish Jones, receptionist
Email:
trish@palmcitypres.org
A native Ohioan, Trish lived with her family in multiple states as her Baptist minister father served in various churches. Following a stint in Okinawa with her Air Force husband, she eventually landed in Texas and then on to South Florida. After working in such diverse positions as a sales coordinator, purchasing agent and project manager for electrical contractors, medical staff coordinator, newspaper and magazine editor and publisher, the US Government, and finally, business administrator for a South Florida church, Trish tried retirement twice â with no success or sense of purpose or fulfillment. A passionate follower of Jesus Christ and a long-time Bible teacher and author of Bible studies, Trish welcomes every opportunity to serve the Lord by serving His people in whatever capacity He makes available.
Favorite book:
The Bible
Favorite movie:
The Ultimate Legacy
If I were a superhero, I would be:
The Wasp - doing good deeds with great power, while invisible
KELLY TULLIDGE, COMMUNICATIONS COORDINATOR
Email:
kelly@palmcitypres.org
K
elly moved to Palm City from Syracuse, NY in 2014 with her husband, Rob, and their children, Ethan (22) and Anna (21). She holds a bachelor's degree in business administration from SUNY Oswego. Previously, Kelly worked in the financial industry and the public school system; she was also a stay-at-home mom. In her free time, Kelly enjoys running, reading, traveling, and spending time outside.
Favorite book:
One Thousand Gifts
by Ann Voskamp or anything by Fredrik Backman
Favorite movie:
Notting Hill
If I were a superhero, I would be: Elastigirl
REVA ROGERS, DIRECTOR OF TRADITIONAL MUSIC
Email:
reva@palmcityp
re
s.org
Reva earned her Bachelor of Arts in vocal performance with emphasis in choral conducting and vocal pedagogy from Southern Virginia University. After five years in Arizona as an elementary music teacher, Reva is thrilled to return to her hometown of Palm City with her husband, to raise their three children and continue her career as both a high school choir director and private vocal instructor.
Favorite book:
Portions of the Sea
Favorite movie:
West Side Story
If I were a superhero, I would be: Captain Marvel
Robb Huff, PRINCIPAL ORGA
nist
Email:
robbhuff81@gmail.com
Born and raised in Kansas, Rob came to Florida in 1998 and
has lived here ever since. He has a Bachelor of Arts in music education and a master's degree in
accounting. Rob works as a contractor at FPL as a project
manager. When he's not working, Rob enjoys family time with his wife, Robyn,
and their kids, Payton, Addy, and Harrison ... and as much college football as he can fit in!
Favorite books:
Mere Christianity
and
Les Miserables
Favorite
movie:
The Italian Job
If I were a superhero, I would be:
... I'm not really into superheroes. Does Jason Bourne count?
David Amerson, youth ministry specialist
Email:
amerson@palmcitypres.org
A Jensen Beach native, David is married to his wife, Hannah, and they have a baby girl, Freya Lee. He brings both heart and experience to this role and will be leading our middle and high school students.
While David works full-time in the aerospace industry, his true passion lies in sharing the gospel and caring for others. He has served with Youth With A Mission (YWAM), reaching communities both in the U.S. and abroad.
Favorite books:
Where the Red Fern Grows
Favorite movie:
Tron
If I were a superhero, I would be:
The Green Lantern
Jennifer Osborne, Children's Ministry Specialist
Email:
jennifer@palmcitypres.org
Jennifer Osborne is from Maryland and holds a degree in elementary education from the University of Tennessee at Chattanooga. In high school and college, she enjoyed playing soccer. She has been a teacher for over 25 years in private child care schools. She has taught infants through school-age children, including during after-school and summer programs. Jennifer is married and has a grown son. She enjoys being outdoors, enjoying nature and animals.
Favorite book (other than
The Bible
): books
about modern
-
day miracles or events that happened clearly because of divine intervention
Favorite movie:
I like movies, but I would much rather see a live show! I saw
Daniel
at Sight and Sound in PA last Christmas
,
and it was one of my favorites!
If I were a superhero, I would be:
Violet (invisible girl) from
The Incredibles

Come Worship With Us!
Palm City Presbyterian Church is a movement of people working together to change lives through gatherings, community groups, events and online resources. Giving God all the glory he deserves.  We would love to hear from you and be happy to answer any questions you have. Fill out this form and our staff will be with you shortly.

UPCOMING EVENTS
Scroll down for special events and ongoing activities.
SERMON SCHEDULE
Family Cookout
Friday, September 12 @ 5:30 p.m.
Kick off the new season with food, fun, and fellowship for all ages. Join us for games, music, a bounce house, and time to connect with each other. Bring your appetite and your whole crew â everyoneâs welcome! The cookout will be outside of Langill Hall from 5:30 to 8:00 p.m.
Please click the image to RSVP!
New Members Class
Sunday, September 14 @ 12:15 p.m.
Ready to learn more about PCPC? You're invited to our next New Members Class on Sunday, September 14. The class will be held in Langill Hall from 12:15 to 1:30 p.m. A light lunch and childcare will be provided.
Please RSVP by clicking the image!
Widows Club Dinner
Thursday, September 25 @ 4:00 p.m.
Invite friends and join us for a get together at
Pastaio in Palm City
!
Located at 3290 SW Martin Downs Blvd, this popular restaurant features handmade pasta, a vibrant happy hour, and many delicious dinner options to choose from, including small plates. See their website
HERE
. We'll meet at 4:00 p.m.
Please RSVP to Lindy Cardinale at
lindycardinale@comcast.net
by Monday, September 22.
Mount Dora Bus Trip
October 25-26, 2025 (Registration due 9/25)
Join us on an exciting overnight bus trip to Mount Dora! For two days and one night, participants will explore the well-known arts and craft fair, plus experience a sightseeing cruise along Lake Dora.
Click the image for details and registration.
Registration is due by September 25.
Click
HERE
to view the informational flyer and paper registration form.
Kids Night at PCPC
Friday, October 10 @ 5:30 p.m.
PCPC will host an evening just for kids on Friday, October 10! Join us for Balloon Bash in Langill Hall from 5:30-8:00 p.m. All children, ages 3-10, are welcome. Parents can enjoy a night out while kids have fun playing games, eating pizza, and meeting new friends. There is no cost to attend.
Please RSVP by clicking the image.
Women's Ministry Breakfast
October 11 @ 9:30 a.m.
Ladies of PCPC: Please join us for our next ministry breakfast
